p: Notably, epidemiological studies, carried out in several countries ( i.e., China, Italy and the United States), suggest that the incidence and severity of the diagnosis of COVID-19 and other TMPRSS2-dependent viral infections are higher in men than in women. In this regard, the role of TMPRSS2 in prostate cancer and the androgen-dependent TMPRSS2 expression has led to speculate that the prevalence of COVID-19 cases in men may possibly be related to TMPRSS2 [71].
